question_stem: A particle moves along a straight line. Its displacement, \(s\) metres, from a fixed point O at time \(t\) seconds is given by \(s = 2t^2 - 9t + 4\).

parts.question_text: Find the values of \(t\) for which the particle is more than 5 metres from O and its velocity is positive.
parts.solution_text:
The particle is more than 5 metres from O when \(|s| > 5\), so \(|2t^2 - 9t + 4| > 5\).  The velocity is given by \(v = \frac{ds}{dt} = 4t - 9\). The velocity is positive when \(4t - 9 > 0\), so \(t > \frac{9}{4} = 2.25\).

Case 1: \(2t^2 - 9t + 4 > 5\)
\(2t^2 - 9t - 1 > 0\)
Using the quadratic formula, \(t = \frac{9 \pm \sqrt{81 - 4(2)(-1)}}{4} = \frac{9 \pm \sqrt{89}}{4}\). So, \(t < \frac{9 - \sqrt{89}}{4} \approx -0.108\) or \(t > \frac{9 + \sqrt{89}}{4} \approx 4.608\).  We require \(t > 2.25\), so \(t > 4.608\).

Case 2: \(2t^2 - 9t + 4 < -5\)
\(2t^2 - 9t + 9 < 0\)
Using the quadratic formula, \(t = \frac{9 \pm \sqrt{81 - 4(2)(9)}}{4} = \frac{9 \pm \sqrt{9}}{4} = \frac{9 \pm 3}{4}\). So, \(t = \frac{6}{4} = 1.5\) or \(t = \frac{12}{4} = 3\). Thus, \(1.5 < t < 3\). We require \(t > 2.25\), so \(2.25 < t < 3\).

Combining both cases with the condition \(t > 2.25\), the final solution is \(2.25 < t < 3\) or \(t > 4.608\).
